channel.title: types on darktable Lua documentation
channel.description: Recent content in types on darktable Lua documentation

item.title: overview
item.description: This section documents types that are specific to darktable’s Lua API.

item.title: _pdf_mode_t
item.description:
enum

The export mode to use for PDF document

Values:

  • normal
  • draft
  • debug

item.title: _pdf_pages_t
item.description:
enum

The different page types for PDF export

Values :

  • all
  • single
  • contact

item.title: avif_color_mode_e
item.description:
enum

Color mode for AVIF

Values:

  • AVIF_COLOR_MODE_RGB
  • AVIF_COLOR_MODE_GRAYSCALE

item.title: avif_compression_type_e
item.description:
enum

AVIF compression mode

Values:

  • AVIF_COMP_LOSSLESS
  • AVIF_COMP_LOSSY

item.title: avif_tiling_e
item.description:
enum

AVIF tiling

Values:

  • AVIF_TILING_ON
  • AVIF_TILING_OFF

item.title: comp_type_t
item.description:
enum

Type of compression for webp

Values:

  • webp_lossy
  • webp_lossless

item.description:
enum

The different elements on which a collection can be filtered

  • DT_COLLECTION_FILTER_STAR_4
  • DT_COLLECTION_FILTER_STAR_5
  • DT_COLLECTION_FILTER_REJECT
  • DT_COLLECTION_FILTER_NOT_REJECT

The different ways in which a collection filter can be compared

The different orders that a collection can be sorted in

item.title: dt_imageio_exr_compression_t
item.description:
enum

The type of compression to use for the EXR image

Values:

  • off
  • rle
  • zips
  • zip
  • piz
  • pxr24
  • b44
  • b44a

item.title: dt_imageio_j2k_format_t
item.description:
enum

J2K format type

Values:

  • j2k
  • jp2

item.title: dt_imageio_j2k_preset_t
item.description:
enum

J2K preset type

Values:

  • off
  • cinema2k_24
  • cinema2k_48
  • cinema4k_24

item.title: dt_imageio_module_format_data_avif
item.description:
dt_type

Type object describing parameters to export to avif.

Attributes:

  • parent : types.dt_imageio_module_format_t

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_data_avif.bit_depth

number

The number of bits per sample to use at export time (8, 10, or 12).

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_data_avif.quality

number

The quality to use at export time.

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_data_avif.compression_type

types.avif_compression_type_e

The image compression type.

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_data_avif.color_mode

types.avif_color_mode_e

The color mode to use for the image.

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_data_avif.tiling

types.avif_tiling_e

The tiling mode to use for the image.

item.description:
dt_type

number

The quality to use at export time.

number

The bpp parameter to use when exporting.

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_data_j2k.format

types.dt_imageio_j2k_format_t

The format to use.

item.title: dt_imageio_module_format_data_jpeg
item.description:
dt_type

Type object describing parameters to export to jpeg.

Attributes:

  • parent : types.dt_imageio_module_format_t

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_data_jpeg.quality

number

The quality to use at export time.

Attributes:

  • write

item.title: dt_imageio_module_format_data_jpegxl
item.description:
dt_type

Type object describing parameters to export to jpegxl.

Attributes:

  • parent : types.dt_imageio_module_format_t

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_data_jpegxl.bpp

number

The bits per pixel to use at export time (10, 12, 16, 32).

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_data_jpegxl.pixel_type

number

Type of format for pixels, 0 for integer or 1 for floating point.

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_data_jpegxl.quality

number

The quality to use at export time.

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_data_jpegxl.original

number

The color profile used by the encoder.

  • 0 - permit internal XYB color space conversion for more efficient lossy compression
  • 1 - ensure no conversion to keep original image color space (implied for lossless)

Attributes:

item.title: dt_imageio_module_format_t
item.description:
dt_type

A virtual type representing all format types.

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_t.plugin_name

string

A unique name for the plugin.

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_t.name

string

A human readable name for the plugin.

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_t.extension

string

The typical filename extension for that format.

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_t.mime

string

The mime type associated with the format.

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_t.max_width

number

The max width allowed for the format (0 = unlimited).

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—dt_imageio_module_format_t.max_height

number

The max height allowed for the format (0 = unlimited).

Attributes:

item.title: dt_lib_collect_mode_t
item.description:
enum

The logical operators to apply between rulesAttributes:

Values:

  • DT_LIB_COLLECT_MODE_AND
  • DT_LIB_COLLECT_MODE_OR
  • DT_LIB_COLLECT_MODE_AND_NOT

item.title: dt_lib_collect_params_rule_t
item.description:
dt_type

A single rule for filtering a collection

ðŸ”—dt_lib_collect_params_rule_t.mode

types.dt_lib_collect_mode_t

How this rule is applied after the previous one. Unused for the first rule

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—dt_lib_collect_params_rule_t.data

string

The text segment of the rule. Exact content depends on the type of rule

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—dt_lib_collect_params_rule_t.item

types.dt_collection_properties_t

The item on which this rule filter. i.e the type of the rule

Attributes:

  • write

The different lighttable layouts

item.title: dt_lua_align_t
item.description:
enum

The alignment of a label

Values:

  • fill
  • start
  • end
  • center
  • baseline

item.title: dt_lua_backgroundjob_t
item.description:
dt_type

A lua-managed entry in the backgroundjob lib

ðŸ”—dt_lua_backgroundjob_t.percent

number

The value of the progress bar, between 0 and 1. will return nil if there is no progress bar, will raise an error if read or written on an invalid job

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—dt_lua_backgroundjob_t.valid

boolean

True if the job is displayed, set it to false to destroy the entry An invalid job cannot be made valid again

Attributes:

  • write

item.title: dt_lua_cairo_t
item.description:
dt_type

A wrapper around a cairo drawing context. You probably shouldn’t use this after the callback that got it passed returned. For more details of the member functions have a look at the cairo documentation for the drawing context, transformations and paths.

ðŸ”—dt_lua_cairo_t.save

self:function(
)

Save the state of the drawing context.

  • self - types.dt_lua_cairo_t - The context to modify.

ðŸ”—types.dt_lua_cairo_t.restore

self:function(
)

Restore a previously saved state.

  • self - types.dt_lua_cairo_t - The context to modify.

ðŸ”—dt_lua_cairo_t.move_to

self:function(
  x : float,
  y : float
)

Begin a new sub-path.

item.title: dt_lua_ellipsize_mode_t
item.description:
enum

The ellipsize mode of a label

Values:

  • none
  • start
  • middle
  • end

item.title: dt_lua_film_t
item.description:
dt_type

A film in darktable; this represents a directory containing imported images.

Attributes:

  • has_tostring

ðŸ”—dt_lua_film_t:move_image

see darktable.database.move_image

ðŸ”—dt_lua_film_t:copy_image

see darktable.database.copy_image

ðŸ”—dt_lua_film_t.#

types.dt_lua_image_t

The different images within the film.

ðŸ”—dt_lua_film_t.id

number A unique numeric id used by this film.

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—dt_lua_film_t.path

string

The path represented by this film.

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—dt_lua_film_t:delete

self:function(
  [force : boolean]
)

Removes the film from the database.

  • self - types.dt_lua_film_t - The film to remove.
  • [force] - boolean - Force removal, even if the film is not empty.

item.title: dt_lua_image_t
item.description:
dt_type

Image objects represent an image in the database. This is slightly different from a file on disk since a file can have multiple developments. Note that this is the real image object; changing the value of a field will immediately change it in darktable and will be reflected on any copy of that image object you may have kept.

Attributes:

  • has_tostring

ðŸ”—dt_lua_image_t:attach_tag

see darktable.tags.attach

ðŸ”—dt_lua_image_t:detach_tag

see darktable.tags.detach

ðŸ”—dt_lua_image_t:get_tags

see darktable.tags.get_tags

ðŸ”—dt_lua_image_t:create_style

see darktable.styles.create

item.title: dt_lua_lib_t
item.description:
dt_type

The type of a UI lib

ðŸ”—dt_lua_lib_t.id

string

A unit string identifying the lib

ðŸ”—dt_lua_lib_t.name

string

The translated title of the UI element

ðŸ”—dt_lua_lib_t.version

number

The version of the internal data of this lib

ðŸ”—dt_lua_lib_t.active_preset

string

The name of the active preset of this lib

ðŸ”—dt_lua_lib_t.visible

boolean

Allow to make a lib module completely invisible to the user. Note that if the module is invisible the user can right click in a panel and make the lib visible.

item.title: dt_lua_orientation_t
item.description:
enum

A possible orientation for a widget

Values:

  • horizontal
  • vertical

item.title: dt_lua_snapshot_t
item.description:
dt_type

The description of a snapshot in the snapshot lib

Attributes:

has_tostring

ðŸ”—dt_lua_snapshot_t.filename

string

The filename of an image containing the snapshot

ðŸ”—dt_lua_snapshot_t:select

self:function(
)

Activates this snapshot on the display. To deactivate all snapshot you need to call this function on the active snapshot

  • self - types.dt_lua_snapshot_t - The snapshot to activate

ðŸ”—dt_lua_snapshot_t.name

string

The name of the snapshot, as seen in the UI

item.title: dt_lua_tag_t
item.description:
dt_type

A tag that can be attached to an image.

Attributes:

has_tostring

ðŸ”—dt_lua_tag_t:delete

see darktable.tags.delete

ðŸ”—dt_lua_tag_t:attach

see darktable.tags.attach

ðŸ”—dt_lua_tag_t:detach

see darktable.tags.detach

ðŸ”—dt_lua_tag_t.name

string

The name of the tag.

ðŸ”—dt_lua_tag_t.flags

integer

  • 1 - tag is a category
  • 2 - tag is private
  • 4 - tag has an images order

ðŸ”—dt_lua_tag_t.synonyms

string

The synonyms of the tag.

ðŸ”—dt_lua_tag_t.#

types.dt_lua_image_t

The images that have that tag attached to them.

item.title: hint_t
item.description:

item.title: lua_box
item.description:
dt_type

A container for widget in a horizontal or vertical list

Attributes:

  • has_tostring
  • parent : types.lua_widget

ðŸ”—lua_box.__call

see types.lua_widget.As a function

ðŸ”—lua_box.extra registration parameters

This widget has no extra registration parameters

ðŸ”—lua_box.orientation

types.dt_lua_orientation_t

The orientation of the box.

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—lua_box.expand

gboolean

Cells expand to fill the width of the box. Defaults to TRUE.

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—lua_box.fill

gboolean

Widget fills the cell. Defaults to TRUE.

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—lua_box.padding

guint

Extra padding in pixels to add to the start of the widget. Defaults to 0.

item.title: lua_combobox
item.description:
dt_type

A widget with multiple text entries in a menu. This widget can be set as editable at construction time. If it is editable the user can type a value and is not constrained by the values in the menu.

Attributes:

  • has_tostring
  • parent : types.lua_widget

ðŸ”—lua_combobox.__call

see types.lua_widget.As a function

ðŸ”—lua_combobox.extra registration parameters

This widget has no extra registration parameters

ðŸ”—lua_combobox.value

string

The text content of the selected entry, can be nil. You can set it to a number to select the corresponding entry from the menu. If the combobox is editable, you can set it to any string. You can set it to nil to deselect all entries.

item.title: lua_container

ðŸ”—lua_container.__call

see types.lua_widget.As a function

ðŸ”—lua_container.extra registration parameters

This widget has no extra registration parameters

ðŸ”—lua_container.#

types.lua_widget

The widgets contained by the box. You can append widgets by adding them at the end of the list. You can remove widgets by setting them to nil.

Attributes:

  • write

item.title: lua_widget
item.description:
dt_type

Common parent type for all lua-handled widgets

Attributes:

  • has_tostring

ðŸ”—lua_widget.extra registration parameters

This widget has no extra registration parameters

ðŸ”—lua_widget.name

string or nil

Name assigned to the widget for CSS styling purposes.

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—lua_widget.sensitive

boolean

Set if the widget is enabled/disabled

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—lua_widget.tooltip

string or nil

Tooltip to display for the widget

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—lua_widget.visible

boolean or nil

Hide or show widget. Default is show.

Attributes:

  • write

ðŸ”—lua_widget.reset_callback

function(
  widget : types.lua_widget
)

A function to call when the widget needs to reset itself. Note that some widgets have a default implementation that can be overridden, (containers in particular will recursively reset their children). If you replace that default implementation you need to reimplement that functionality or call the original function within your callback.

item.title: snapshot_direction_t
item.description:

Which part of the main window is occupied by a snapshot

Values:

  • right
  • top
  • bottom
